column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Hannesson (Iceland): Security Council\r
#Text=resolution 1325 (2000) lays down the ground rules for\r
#Text=women to play a central role in conflict prevention,\r
#Text=peacekeeping and peace-building.
#Text=The key issue now is\r
#Text=implementation.
#Text=Like those who preceded us, we\r
#Text=welcome the decision by the presidency to hold this\r
#Text=open debate to mark the resolution's third anniversary.
#Text=Such debates remain necessary, considering how far we\r
#Text=are from full implementation.
#Text=By adopting the resolution, the Security Council\r
#Text=acknowledged that women have a role to play, whether\r
#Text=it concerns conflict prevention, peace negotiations,\r
#Text=peacekeeping or reconstruction.
#Text=The United Nations involvement in such\r
#Text=processes and its promotion of gender equality is a key\r
#Text=element to establish peace and security in conflict\r
#Text=regions.
#Text=The Security Council should put the same\r
#Text=effort into ensuring the implementation of resolution\r
#Text=1325 (2000) as it puts into all its other resolutions.
#Text=The\r
#Text=effectiveness of the United Nations and its\r
#Text=international authority ultimately rest on the extent to\r
#Text=which it is seen to implement its own decisions.
#Text=Iceland has consistently supported gender\r
#Text=equality and the advancement of women.
#Text=Resolution\r
#Text=1325 (2000) is an important element of the United\r
#Text=Nations agenda in that field.
#Text=The Icelandic Government has, for the past three\r
#Text=years, been financing the post of a gender expert at the\r
#Text=United Nations Development Fund for Women\r
#Text=(UNIFEM) office in Kosovo, where UNIFEM. has been\r
#Text=playing an important role in advancing gender equality.
#Text=The Icelandic Government stresses the importance of\r
#Text=hiring both men and women for the Icelandic\r
#Text=peacekeeping unit.
#Text=We welcome the appointment of an interim\r
#Text=Gender Adviser to the Department of Peacekeeping\r
#Text=Operations.
#Text=We hope that the permanent position of\r
#Text=Senior Gender Adviser will be filled shortly.
#Text=Staff\r
#Text=working directly on gender issues must be included in\r
#Text=all peacekeeping operations and afforded effective\r
#Text=authority to ensure compliance at all levels.
#Text=We also\r
#Text=encourage the Secretary-General, as a matter of\r
#Text=priority, to appoint more women as special\r
#Text=representatives and envoys, as called for in resolution\r
#Text=Iceland was the tenth State to ratify the Rome\r
#Text=Statute of the International Criminal Court (ICC).
#Text=The\r
#Text=entry-into-force of the Statute and the establishment of\r
#Text=the Court represent a major breakthrough for the\r
#Text=protection of human rights, including those of women.
#Text=It recognizes, inter alia, the specific impact of armed\r
#Text=conflict on women by criminalizing sexual and gender\r
#Text=violence and puts an end to impunity through ensuring\r
#Text=effective investigation and prosecution of those crimes\r
#Text=by the Court.
#Text=It also addresses another very important\r
#Text=subject that is reflected in resolution 1325 (2000): by\r
#Text=being the most gender-balanced bench of all\r
#Text=international judicial institutions, the ICC provides an\r
#Text=excellent example of how to ensure the increased\r
#Text=representation of women at all decision-making levels.
